description: The underlying cause of CVE-2023-38545 is a heap buffer overflow in the implementation of the socks5 proxy within curl.exe, particularly when the '- - limit - rate' option is set to a value of 65540 or lower. This vulnerability enables an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely if the curl utility is invoked improperly. The affected software is contained within various builds of Microsoft Windows, specifically builds: 10.0.22631.2715, 10.0.22621.2715, 10.0.19044.3693, and 10.0.19045.3693. Microsoft has addressed this issue in curl version 8.4.0, included in the Windows security updates released on November 14, 2023. Relevant knowledge base articles include KB-5032192, KB-5032190, and KB-5032189.
